intro: Plantaginella, commonly known as the "false plantain," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plantaginaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often pale or greenish in color. They are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Many species are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments, showing drought tolerance. The genus includes around 150 species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes.
